MAN.

Dogen!

It won't be pretty.

Rrrr!

Holy smokes. Look at that.
Well, then, here's the first half of your reward!

Great Odin's Rake!
I don't think anyone's ever done the whole thing before!

Congratulations. Now git.

I thought I recognized you in my dream, but I couldn't be sure. Now that I see you in your element, there's no doubt.
You're Ford Cruller.
The greatest leader the Psychonauts ever had.
Well, you shouldn't believe everything you read in "True Psychic Tales" magazine.
What are you doing here? You said that girl was waiting for you down by the water! That's Lungfish territory, boy! Go and get her!
Razputin, come up here. There's something you should see.
You're the only one left, son.
Can't even make a connection with Sasha or Milla right now for some reason...
Sasha said he had some official Psychonauts business...
Impossible. I would know it if they did. Nope, something's happened to them.
Razputin, listen. You're the only one who can stop Oleander now.
What about you?
I... I can't leave this cave, Razputin.
Not as the Ford Cruller you know.
What? Why?
Years ago I was in a terrible psychic duel that left me barely alive.
Yeah, I read about that. They said your psyche was shattered, that you lost your mind, but... you seem fine to me.
Yes, when I'm down here, near the Psitanium mother lode. The concentrated power of the Psitanium pulls my thoughts together, keeps me... like my old self.
But if I leave this sanctuary my psyche becomes disjointed, and I fall into one of my other personalities, with no memory of who I really am.
I'd be no use to you, unless you needed something raked... or mopped...
Well, you can call headquarters and get help!

The Psychonauts won't listen to me. They wrote me off as a loon years ago. That's why Sasha and Milla have to take on all my missions. Headquarters doesn't know I'm the one behind the assignments or they'd never get approved.
But Sasha and Milla seem to be out of commission now.
YOU have to be my field agent, Razputin.
Are you ready?
Yes!
No. Not yet.
How about now?
Good.
You have to find where that monster took the girl, and if you locate any of the other children's brains along the way, bring them back to me for recranialization, understand?
Ew. I mean, yes sir!
Agent Cruller?
So, how goes the training?
What is the current situation?
I'm ready to go back into the field.
Hey, you wandered off, so I lost the coordinates. What do you think? I got a photographic memory?
Okay, let's see if I remember exactly where you were...
What are you doing here at Whispering Rock?
This training facility is built right smack on top of the largest Psitanium deposit known to man.
It runs under this whole valley and makes this a very critical area for the Psychonauts, so I'm here to look after it.
And to make sure you little spoonbenders don't kill each other.
What's Psitanium?
Psitanium is a very rare, psychoreactive mineral that crashed here on a meteorite hundreds of years ago.
It responds to psychic waves. Focuses them, amplifies them.

It can make psychics more psychic, but it can also make unstable people more unstable. Not everyone can handle that much activity in that part of their brain. It can drive them completely out of their gourd.
Gives this valley an interesting history.
Sasha says I need to learn how to fight better.
He wants to teach you advanced combat? On your first day?
Yeah. I had a vision with a huge monster with yellow eyes and a big mouth full of gnashing teeth...
Did it happen to... spit anything at you?
Yeah. I think it was like an old diving helmet or something.
I see. Hmm. Yes, well, we'd better get you armed.
Why? What's happening?
Nothing, nothing. "Prepare Your Mind." That's the motto of the Psychonauts.  Here.
This is a Marksmanship Learner's Permit. It will only work when you're in Sasha's mind.
Once you complete his shooting range, you'll get the real merit badge and you can PSI Blast anywhere you want.
Thanks. PSI Blast?
Ah, you'll find out. Now get going. We can't have the camp overrun with big-eyed, garbage-spitting monsters, can we?
No sir!
I saw you raking leaves. Was that a disguise?
...and flipping burgers...
...and polishing a canoe...
...and sweeping a porch...
Er, yes. Well, well, I have many disguises. It helps me keep an eye on you kids wherever you go. Heh heh.
Now, when I'm in disguise, I may pretend not to recognize you. Don't blow my cover, okay?
Say no more. Your secret identity is safe with me.
So what mission are you on down here?
Well, from here I can monitor world events, look for signs of psychic terrorism, ripples in the astral plane...
And then fly out and save the day, right? You've got a jet hidden here somewhere, I'll bet.
Well these days I'm really just more of a dispatcher. I spot the trouble and send out a... younger agent. Like Milla or Sasha... or maybe you some day.
What does all this equipment do?
Well, up here it's all intel.
Down that hallway is the observation room. No tests going on in there right now. Maybe later.
And beneath us I have special machines for rebuilding PSI Challenge Markers and detangling Mental Cobwebs.
And beneath us I have special machines for rebuilding PSI Challenge Markers, detangling Mental Cobwebs, and crystallizing DEPLETED PSITANIUM.
You should go familiarize yourself with those. They'll come in pretty handy for you.
I'd better go. Lots of work to do.
Good luck, Razputin!
Thanks. I'll need it!
Don't worry. I'll be right here with you. Inside your head!
My head?
Yep. I want to keep my eye on you, son. So I'm going to be a psychic stowaway inside your noggin!
If you ever want to make me appear, you can do it with this special device.
Is that... a piece of bacon?
Ohh yeah. I just love bacon. I smell that stuff and I can't help it! I drop everything and I come running!
Okay, do you have, like, a little baggie or something I could put this in?
You get a move on or I'll eat that right here!
Hey, that white room--
I know! It's from Oleander's mind!
I think I was in the Coach's dream that whole time! Ever since I stepped through the static in the caravan, it felt funny. I knew I wasn't obsessed with meat!
But Morry is. AND with stealing psychic brains to arm a fleet of deadly tanks, apparently!
I've got to tell Lili. She's waiting for me down by the boathouse.
Down by the... water? Uh oh. Better hurry!
Let's get 'em!
I... can't. I can't swim.
Well then use the bathysphere at the end of the dock! Quick, while the flipper prints are still glowin'!
Are you coming? I don't know how to drive that thing.
Uh... I can't. I have to uh.. check on the other children! Yes, yes! If their brains are out they'll need supervision. And possibly refrigeration�
And how can you not know how to operate a bathysphere? Haven't you ever been to summer camp before?
Now get a move on, before that girl gets overly digested.
Now before you go electrocuting yourself, let me tell you how these babies work.
Now this beauty here is a Mental Cobweb Detangler.
Ooh, I know what those are. Mental cobwebs are--
You see, when an area of your psyche is neglected for too long, mental cobwebs form.
Now up in the camp store, they sell a very special device known as a Mental Cobweb Duster.
You can take a projection of it into the mental world with you and use it to extract any cobwebs you find.
The duster stores the cobweb's psychic energy on the real world side, so you can take what you collect back here...
...hook it up to the loom, and weave that tangled mess into something useful!
Like a card from a PSI Challenge Marker!

Rank up enough, you'll earn new Psychic abilities!
You got it?
Put my mental cobwebs in there...
...and my PSI Cards and Cores in there.
And soon I'll be able to burn stuff.
Yep, basically. Have fun!
Son, I will teleport you deep into that solid rock over there, you don't knock that off.
Now why did I give him that dang learner's permit?
I didn't train you in that so you could set me on fire. Now knock it off!
Very nice. Now set me down easy and go pick up something that won't blow up your head if you make it mad.
Hey, not bad! If you didn't eat so much garlic I wouldn't even know you were here!
Ahh, what? No, I--I have to flip... the burgers. No, m--mop the--the... the rake. Uh--ahh! My canoes!
Oh no. The attacks are starting even in here! Have to get a bigger Psitanium boulder under the glass...

Well I'm glad to see you made some new friends, after all your old ones got their brains sucked out.
Ford said that I can use this machine to turn pine needles into delicious taffy.
I said it turns Mental Cobwebs into PSI Cards!
Just testing your hearing!
But you gotta buy a cobweb duster at the camp store first!
Yeah, yeah.
Ah, don't you "yeah, yeah" me!

Bat your head in, punk.
Before I use this machine I have to go to the camp store and buy some delicious taffy.
A Mental Cobweb Duster!
A Mental Cobweb Duster.

That machine is for collecting mental cobwebs ONLY.
No monkey business!
